episodeTitle: Parting Builds a Man's Character! Sanji and Chopper!
japaneseName: 別れが男を磨く！サンジとチョッパー
romanizedName: Wakare ga otoko o migaku! Sanji to Choppā
description: A filler recap episode featuring flashbacks to Sanji's emotional departure from the Baratie restaurant and Chopper's decision to leave Drum Island to join Luffy's crew. The episode also includes a comedic 'No Respect Time' segment where Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji are reimagined as mafia bosses.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Straw Hat Version)
openingSong.artist: Hiroshi Kitadani and the Straw Hat Pirates cast

events.title: Episode Begins as Recap Filler
events.description: The episode opens with a recap format, indicating this will be a flashback episode focusing on Sanji and Chopper's backstories and their decisions to join the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Provides context for newer viewers or reminds longtime fans of the emotional moments when Sanji and Chopper joined the crew during the East Blue and Drum Island arcs respectively.

events.title: Sanji's Childhood Flashback
events.description: The episode shows flashbacks to Sanji as a child, recapping his past and the experiences that shaped him into becoming a cook.
events.significance: Reminds viewers of Sanji's formative years and his dream of finding All Blue, which motivated him to become a pirate.

events.title: Sanji and Zeff's Bond Recalled
events.description: Flashback scenes show the deep father-son relationship between Sanji and Zeff, the head chef of Baratie who raised Sanji and taught him everything about cooking.
events.significance: Emphasizes the emotional weight of Sanji's decision to leave Baratie and pursue his dream, showing the sacrifice and support Zeff provided.

events.title: Sanji's Decision to Join Luffy Recalled
events.description: The episode recaps the moment when Sanji decided to leave the Baratie restaurant and join Luffy's crew as their cook, pursuing his dream of finding All Blue.
events.significance: Recalls one of the most emotional moments in the East Blue Saga, when Sanji overcame his attachment to Baratie to chase his dream.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Declaring his dream as he decides to join Luffy

events.title: Sanji's Tearful Farewell to Zeff
events.description: Flashback to the emotional scene where Sanji tearfully thanks Zeff for everything, kneeling on the dock as he bids farewell to his father figure and the Baratie crew.
events.significance: One of the most iconic emotional moments in One Piece, showcasing Sanji's gratitude and the depth of his relationship with Zeff.

quotes.text: Owner Zeff! For all the years I spent here... Thank you for putting up with my shit! I owe you everything!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Chopper's Past on Drum Island
events.description: The episode shifts to Chopper's backstory, showing flashbacks to his life on Drum Island as an outcast reindeer who ate the Human-Human Fruit.
events.significance: Reminds viewers of Chopper's tragic past of rejection and loneliness before meeting Dr. Hiriluk and finding acceptance.

events.title: Dr. Hiriluk and Chopper's Bond
events.description: Flashback scenes show the heartwarming relationship between Chopper and Dr. Hiriluk, the eccentric doctor who accepted Chopper despite his appearance and taught him about medicine and dreams.
events.significance: Highlights the formative relationship that inspired Chopper to become a doctor and showed him that he could be accepted despite being different.

events.title: Dr. Hiriluk's Death Recalled
events.description: The episode recalls the tragic death of Dr. Hiriluk, who sacrificed himself to protect Chopper and inspire hope in Drum Island, declaring that a man dies when he is forgotten.
events.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece, Hiriluk's death and his philosophy about legacy profoundly shaped Chopper's worldview and medical practice.

quotes.text: When do you think people die? When they are shot through the heart by the bullet of a pistol? No. When they are ravaged by an incurable disease? No. When they drink a soup made from a poisonous mushroom? No! It's when... they are forgotten!
quotes.speaker: Dr. Hiriluk
quotes.context: Hiriluk's final speech about the nature of death

events.title: Dr. Kureha Takes Chopper as Apprentice
events.description: Flashback shows Dr. Kureha taking Chopper under her wing after Hiriluk's death, continuing his medical training and becoming his new mentor.
events.significance: Establishes how Chopper became a skilled doctor under Kureha's tutelage, carrying on Hiriluk's legacy.

events.title: Luffy Invites Chopper to Join the Crew
events.description: The episode recalls the moment when Luffy persistently invited Chopper to join the Straw Hat Pirates as their doctor, despite Chopper's initial refusal due to being a monster reindeer.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's characteristic acceptance of others regardless of their appearance or past, which was crucial in convincing Chopper to join.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's famous line cutting off Chopper's excuses and insisting he join

events.title: Chopper's Decision to Join Recalled
events.description: Flashback to Chopper's emotional decision to accept Luffy's invitation and leave Drum Island to join the Straw Hat Pirates, finally finding a place where he belongs.
events.significance: Marks Chopper becoming the sixth member of the Straw Hat Pirates and finding the acceptance he had always sought.

events.title: Dr. Kureha's Farewell Gift
events.description: The episode recalls Dr. Kureha creating a beautiful pink snow cherry blossom effect as a farewell to Chopper, fulfilling Hiriluk's dream of creating miracle cherry blossoms on Drum Island.
events.significance: An emotionally powerful moment showing how Hiriluk's dream was realized, giving Chopper a beautiful send-off that honored his mentor's legacy.

events.title: No Respect Time Comedy Segment Begins
events.description: The episode transitions to a comedic 'No Respect Time' (Jinginai Time) segment, part of the Mugiwara Theatre series, featuring mafia-themed parody versions of the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Provides comic relief and showcases a creative reimagining of the characters in a yakuza/mafia setting, part of One Piece's tradition of playful omake content.

events.title: Don Luffione, Don Zoroscia, and Don Sanjino Debut
events.description: The three mafia boss versions of the main Straw Hats appear: Don Luffione (Luffy with slicked-back hair and cigar), Don Zoroscia (Zoro as a mafia boss), and Don Sanjino (Sanji in mafia attire).
events.significance: Introduction of these parody characters who would later become the basis for collectible figures and merchandise, showing the playful side of One Piece.

events.title: Mafia Leaders Meet to Discuss Issues
events.description: The three mafia bosses (Don Luffione, Don Zoroscia, and Don Sanjino) meet to discuss various issues in the mafia world, parodying classic yakuza/gangster film tropes.
events.significance: Parodies Japanese yakuza films and culture, a comedic nod to a genre well-known in Japanese cinema.

events.title: Don Zoroscia Declares War
events.description: After an argument during the mafia meeting, Don Zoroscia (Zoro's mafia persona) declares war on the other mafia families, leading to comedic conflict.
events.significance: Provides humor by having the normally loyal Straw Hats in conflict with each other in this parody setting, playing on Zoro's serious and confrontational nature.

quotes.text: Owner Zeff! For all the years I spent here... Thank you for putting up with my shit! I owe you everything!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's emotional farewell to Zeff at Baratie

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji declaring his dream as he joins Luffy

quotes.text: When do you think people die? When they are shot through the heart by the bullet of a pistol? No. When they are ravaged by an incurable disease? No. When they drink a soup made from a poisonous mushroom? No! It's when... they are forgotten!
quotes.speaker: Dr. Hiriluk
quotes.context: Hiriluk's famous philosophy about death and legacy

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's iconic line insisting Chopper join the crew

themes.description: The episode explores how leaving behind loved ones and familiar places can be a necessary step for personal growth and pursuing one's dreams, as both Sanji and Chopper had to leave their mentors to join the Straw Hats.
themes.symbolism: The title 'Parting Builds a Man's Character' directly states this theme - separation from the familiar is portrayed as essential for maturation.
culturalReferences: The importance of mentorship in Japanese culture

themes.description: Both Sanji and Chopper honor their mentors (Zeff and Hiriluk) by carrying forward what they learned and pursuing the dreams inspired by them.
themes.symbolism: The cherry blossoms created by Kureha represent Hiriluk's dream living on through Chopper, while Sanji's pursuit of All Blue honors Zeff's encouragement.
culturalReferences: Japanese concepts of on (obligation/debt of gratitude)

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how finding a place where one is accepted for who they are - flaws and all - is crucial for happiness, particularly highlighted in Chopper's story.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's simple acceptance of Chopper as a 'cool reindeer' represents the Straw Hats' inclusive nature.

themes.description: Both crew members joined the Straw Hats to pursue impossible dreams (All Blue for Sanji, becoming a great doctor and finding acceptance for Chopper).
themes.symbolism: The vast ocean represents limitless possibilities for those brave enough to pursue their dreams.

characterSpotlights.development: The episode revisits Sanji's emotional journey from being a young chef at Baratie under Zeff's guidance to making the difficult decision to leave and pursue his dream of finding All Blue with Luffy.
keyActions: Flashback to childhood and training under Zeff
Decision to join Luffy's crew
Emotional farewell to Zeff and the Baratie crew
quotes: Owner Zeff! For all the years I spent here... Thank you for putting up with my shit! I owe you everything!

characterSpotlights.development: The episode recaps Chopper's tragic backstory as an outcast reindeer, his relationships with Dr. Hiriluk and Dr. Kureha, and his eventual decision to join the Straw Hats and pursue his dream of becoming a great doctor.
keyActions: Flashback to life as an outcast on Drum Island
Bonding with Dr. Hiriluk
Training under Dr. Kureha after Hiriluk's death
Accepting Luffy's invitation to join the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Shown as the father figure who raised Sanji, taught him cooking, and ultimately supported his decision to pursue his dreams despite the pain of separation.
keyActions: Training Sanji in cooking
Encouraging Sanji to follow his dreams
Giving Sanji his blessing to leave Baratie

characterSpotlights.development: Portrayed as the eccentric doctor who first showed Chopper acceptance and kindness, teaching him about medicine and the power of dreams before his tragic death.
keyActions: Accepting Chopper despite his appearance
Teaching Chopper about medicine
Sacrificing himself to protect Chopper
Delivering his famous speech about death and being forgotten
quotes: When do you think people die? When they are shot through the heart by the bullet of a pistol? No. When they are ravaged by an incurable disease? No. When they drink a soup made from a poisonous mushroom? No! It's when... they are forgotten!

characterSpotlights.development: Shown as the tough but caring doctor who took over Chopper's training after Hiriluk's death and ultimately gave him a beautiful send-off when he left to join the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Taking Chopper as her apprentice
Continuing his medical training
Creating the cherry blossom snow as a farewell

characterSpotlights.role: Recruiter in flashbacks and comedy segment
characterSpotlights.development: Shown recruiting both Sanji and Chopper with his characteristic directness and acceptance. Also appears as Don Luffione in the comedy segment.
keyActions: Inviting Sanji to join the crew
Persistently inviting Chopper despite refusals
Appearing as mafia boss Don Luffione in comedy segment

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler content. There is no manga equivalent as it's a recap episode with a comedy segment.

trivia.fact: This is a recap/filler episode that aired during the Enies Lobby arc, providing a break in the intense ongoing storyline.
The 'No Respect Time' (Jinginai Time) segment is part of the Mugiwara Theatre series, which features comedic parody versions of the Straw Hat Pirates in various scenarios.
The mafia boss characters (Don Luffione, Don Zoroscia, Don Sanjino) later became collectible figures, first released in April 2010.
This episode has a notably lower IMDB rating (5.9) compared to canon episodes, typical for recap filler episodes.
The episode recaps two of One Piece's most emotional moments: Sanji's farewell to Zeff (Episode 30) and Hiriluk's death and philosophy speech (Episode 86).
Dr. Hiriluk's speech about when people truly die ('when they are forgotten') is considered one of the most philosophical and memorable quotes in the entire One Piece series.
